description: Portuguese are a naval and gunpowder civilization that excels in water maps and has strong late-game options.
dark_age: Start with 3 villagers, a scout, and a caravel.
Build 2 houses and a dock near fish.
Train additional villagers from the town center and a second caravel from the dock.
Research loom and build a fishing ship.
Use the caravel to explore the map and find resources.
Advance to Feudal Age at around 14-15 minutes with 500 food and 200 gold.
Have around 1000-1200 food, 200-300 wood, and 100-150 gold at the end of the Dark Age.
Assign 4-5 villagers to food, 2-3 to wood, 1-2 to gold, and 3-4 to stone.
feudal_age: Build a blacksmith and market to upgrade navy and sell excess resources for gold.
Build a second dock and produce galleys and fire ships.
Advance to Castle Age at around 20-21 minutes with 800 food and 400 gold.
Have around 2000-2500 food, 500-600 wood, 400-500 gold, and 200-300 stone at the end of the Feudal Age.
Assign 8-10 villagers to food, 5-6 to wood, 3-4 to gold, and 6-7 to stone.
castle_age: Continue producing navy and research Careening and Dry Dock upgrades.
Build a monastery and research Fervor and Sanctity upgrades for monks.
Build a university and research Ballistics and Chemistry upgrades for gunpowder units.
Advance to Imperial Age at around 30-31 minutes with 1000 food, 1000 gold, and 800 stone.
Have around 4000-4500 food, 1500-2000 wood, 1500-2000 gold, and 1000-1200 stone at the end of the Castle Age.
Assign 20-25 villagers to food, 12-15 to wood, 10-12 to gold, and 15-20 to stone.
imperial_age: Continue producing navy and research Shipwright and Cannon Galleon upgrades.
Use Cannon Galleons to take out enemy navy and buildings from a distance.
Have around 6000-7000 food, 3000-4000 wood, and 3000-4000 gold in the late Imperial Age.
Assign 40-50 villagers to food, 20-25 to wood, 16-20 to gold, and 25-30 to stone.
